intro: Pocockia cilicica, commonly known as the Cilician stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the rocky regions of southeastern Turkey. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, adapting it to arid environments. The plant typically grows in crevices and on rock surfaces, showcasing its ability to thrive in harsh, dry conditions. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or white, adding a subtle ornamental value. Pocockia cilicica is often cultivated in rock gardens due to its low maintenance and unique appearance.
